definition: non-Han people, esp. from central Asia/reckless/outrageous/what?/why?/to complete a winning hand at mahjong (also written 和[hu2])
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]

sentences.english: The patient began to rave incoherently at the nurses.
sentences.chinese: 病人对护士说起胡话来。

sentences.english: Are you going to listen to her ravings?
ShenXing face zhao, a lot of nonsense.
sentences.chinese: 沈星面对赵来说了一大堆胡话。

sentences.english: That's why nonsense verse has such appeal to young children.
sentences.chinese: 这就是为什么胡话诗对小孩子有特别的吸引力。

sentences.english: Who's been telling you such stuff?
sentences.chinese: 是谁和你说的这些胡话？

sentences.english: Jean Valjean stared him straight in the eye and thought that he was raving.
sentences.chinese: 冉阿让直着双眼，老望他，以为他在说胡话。

sentences.english: Rebecca: I think that's a bunch of nonsense. It seemed ok to me.
sentences.chinese: 我认为他在那说胡话，在我看来他一点事不曾。

sentences.english: The doctor thought that she was delirious. She added
While he had the fever,he raved all night long.
sentences.chinese: 他在发高烧的时候，说了一夜的胡话。

sentences.english: As you slept, you cried out a number of times in delirium , she said.
sentences.chinese: 你睡的时候，说胡话大喊了好多次，她说。

sentences.english: He raved all night in his fever.
sentences.chinese: 他发烧时，整个晚上都说胡话。

sentences.english: These are the mere ravings of megalomaniacs.
sentences.chinese: 这是自大狂者的一派胡话。
他在高烧中不停地说胡话。

definition: babbling nonsense (idiom); crazy and unfounded ravings/double Dutch
talking in one's sleep/words spoken during sleep/fig. speech bearing no relation to reality/delusions
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
to speak without thinking/to blurt sth out
not to the point/wide of the mark/neither here nor there/irrelevant
